reviews.title: Not a Resort!
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a 2 night stay at the Harbourtowne "Resort." We decided to go here because the rooms offered a view of the bay, and the one we picked had a wood burning stove. The off season rate didn't seem too bad at $140/night, but that's where the good comments end. We both travel quite a bit and can say without a doubt that this place has the WORST BEDS of any hotel ever! The bed was literally lumpy and practically sitting on the ground. My husband had such bad back pain, that we decided to get up early just to drive home. Also, the "motel" styled heater would only blow the same temperature of hot air no matter what setting. It was impossible to get the room at a comfortable temperature. I had to get up 3 times in the middle of the night to shut it off and turn it back on again. It would go from being a sauna to freezing. Then, the railing around our patio area had a loose board that kept banging when the wind would blow which also kept me up half the night. The worst part about this was at checkout when we told the front desk, they had little to say other than sorry. We will NOT go back to this place. I recommend sticking with the local B&B's.

reviews.title: service very dissappointing
reviews.text: My work group made reservations months early, requested specific accommodations that were available and so signed the contract with the hotel. We checked 2 weeks prior to arriving to assure we had the requested accommodations and were told we did. One day prior to our arrival, we were called and told that some other group wanted those accommodations so over half of our group was being bumped to less desireable motel style rooms. When it was pointed out to the hotel manager that this was not ever our experience with other hotels, she said that they "were not like other hotels". Apparently not. In addition, the manager was rude and offered our group nothing to make up for this unhospital behavior. When asked she flatly refused. The setting on the water is great, the food is not very good (the breakfast buffet on one morning consisted of breads and a kind of cheese whiz omelet, no meat of any kind). The service staff tried their best, but the overall experience was extremely dissapointing.

reviews.title: Resort Prices for Cheap Motel Feel
reviews.text: This was a bit of a disappointment. We were staying here for a wedding and found our room to be cheap feeling. I can assure you that spending more then $200 per night, I have no need to steal the iron... there is no need to bolt it to the ironing board. The front desk seemed to be surprised to have guests checking in and would give very little information by phone. We always needed to come, in person, to the front desk to ask questions. I would not recommend this property.

reviews.title: great getaway
reviews.text: Great getaway. Nice waterfont room. Challenging golf course. Will return again.

Tripadvisor has helped me choose hotels - but usually it's the people who LOVED IT or HATED it that writes, so I'm in between and will try to be objective. First time to St Michaels, 9 of us staying there. Almost all rooms are in seperate buildings, first floor, like attached apartments. Views and surroundings are AMAZING at this resort, just beautiful. Right on the water, no matter where you walk around this resort. Everything there was decent, rooms just ok (some problems, but staff fixed them) but I stayed in the "900" building, where you have your own porch overlooking water 20 feet away, my kids played in the water and the pier in front of our "porch" while we relaxed (you can't do this in all buildings). Free buffet breakfast every am, decent, will fill you up, and pool is very nice. Not only will we remember our family reunion, but we will remember this beautiful hotel for years. It's not 5 star service or rooms, maybe a 3 star, but breathtaking surroundings. We're so glad to take home these memories.
reviews.title: beautiful surroundings
Disappointment
reviews.text: We were hoping for a nice weekend getaway. There were many different reviews for Harbourtowne Resort, but we were optimistic and proceeded with our vacation. We pulled up to our destination and saw no one and hardly any cars in the lot. The desk greeters did anything but greet you. The view of the water was beautiful. This is not a resort!! It resembles something from the 70s that should be upgraded. It lacked the feeling of a getaway. We actually left after 1 day and didn't stay around for our free breakfast. Reconsider!!

Do not go to Harbourtowne expecting a resort property. If you're wanting to get away to a nice, quiet getaway location with a beautiful view and settle for just that, this is the place. The rooms are average at best (clean, comfortable, and average motel size), but amenities and service are definitely lacking.
reviews.title: Great Location, Average Motel, Definitely Not a Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The physical layout consists of a number of detached buildings housing three rooms each, all with a bay view but disconnected from one another as well as the central reception area.
reviews.title: overall, a good value and good experience

likes.disliked: — appearance of rooms from outside, light bulbs did not throw a warm light

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While at Harbourtowne for a three-day business offsite meeting, I was extremely disappointed with the quality of food (some of which was actually inedible), bar service (no cocktail waitresses on the payroll and a total inventory of two brandy snifters) and normal hotel amenities (broken or missing vending machines, no gift/snack shop, etc.)
reviews.title: Don't Be Fooled

reviews.text: If you're planning to visit as an individual (not as part of a pre-arranged group) you should also be prepared for the dining facility to be closed for private business funcitons. If this is the case, you're going to have to drive a few miles into town to get a meal.
reviews.title: Good location, large rooms

reviews.text: Front desk could use some manners training. Views were wonderful, but rooms were out of date. We were there for a small conference, and those facilities were fine. Did not eat on site. Not close enough to walk into the town (the hotel itself is tucked way in the back of a private community); golf course looked nice (but we don't golf).
reviews.title: Okay, nothing special

reviews.text: We requested a king bed, we confirmed a king bed, we got 2 doubles and the front desk said there was nothing that could be done about it (the hotel was empty except for our group and we took up very few rooms; they refused to contact our event coordinator to see if she could switch a room with another guest). Also, they knew nothing about restaurants/shops in town when we asked where we might get this or that. I found that quirky at best.
reviews.title: Service lacking. Location great. Hotel average.
Great view... not great service
reviews.text: The Harbourtowne is in a beautiful location on the Bay. The Hotel has below average service. I was unable to secure a corkscrew in my room to open a bottle of wine. I was told to bring it to the bar and they would open it for me. Everyone at the front desk seemed as though it was their first day working at the hotel. The room was average. It was clean and had fairly good amenities. I would recommend paying a bit more for a nicer hotel closer to the town.

reviews.title: WE had a good time
reviews.text: I attended a Conference with co-workers that was being held at the Harbourtowne resort. We were not happy with the service both at the front desk and in the restaurant. The front desk staff were actually somewhat rude. We are an easy-going group and not that difficult to please.
